description: A esrSystemTrap is sent by the agent when a system
event is triggered. These events are usually triggered
when the software encounters an unexpected situation
e.g. a hardware failure or a software bug.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrSystemTrap MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapEventIndex i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapTime t 31536000 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapDescr s EXAMPLE MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapType i 7 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapSeverity i 40 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapDTM s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAM MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResType i 1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResLeaf i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapValueType i 1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapValue s EXAMPLE MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapEpochTime i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapID i 9999

$SNMPTRAPCMD MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrSystemTrap MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapEventIndex i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapTime t 31536000 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapDescr s EXAMPLE MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapType i 7 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapSeverity i 0 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapDTM s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAM MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResType i 1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResLeaf i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapValueType i 1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapValue s EXAMPLE MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapEpochTime i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapID i 9999

description: The index that uniquely identifies the event that caused this trap.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapEventIndex

description: The value of sysUpTime when this event was triggered.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapTime

description: The event log description.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapDescr

description: The type of event that caused this trap.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapType

description: The severity associated with this event. It is recommended that the
severity be interpreted in the following manner:
0-19: Normal
20-39: Informational
40-59: Warning
60-79: Alarm
80-99: Severe Error
100: Failure.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapSeverity

description: The date and time when this trap was sent. The format is yy-Mon-
dd hh:mm:ss, time is in 24 hour time.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapDTM

description: The type of object (if provided) that triggered this event. If not provided
the value is equal to 'Invalid Resource'.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResType

description: The instance of this resource (if provided - see esrEventTrapResType)
that triggered this event.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResID

description: A number corresponding to the attribute associated with this resource and
this event entry. It corresponds exactly to the leaf MIB number of the MIB
that manages this resource. For example, if a port's mode changed, the
configuration event log entry would indicate the value of 5 which is the
leaf index of the esrPortMode within the esrPortTable MIB table.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResLeaf

description: The data type associated with the trap event value. This object indicates
how to interpret the data stored in the event trap value:
- none(1) indicates no value returned.
- integer32(2) - a 4 byte unsigned integer.
- integer64(3) - an 8 byte unsigned integer.
- displayString(4) - a null terminated (or up to 8 characters) string.
- ipv4NetworkAddress(5) - a 4 byte IP version 4 network address.
- ieee802MACAddress(6) - a 6 byte MAC Address.
- timeticks(7) - sysUpTime type value (4 bytes)
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapValueType

description: The value associated with the event encoded in an octet string. Refer to
esrEventTrapValueType for how to interpret this value.
The value encoded in this string is in Big Endian order.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapValue

description: The number of time ticks since the epoch when this
event was logged. The interpretation of this value is
as follows:
struct DateTimeOvly {
UNS32 year:6;
UNS32 month:4;
UNS32 day:5;
UNS32 hour:5;
UNS32 minute:6;
UNS32 second:6;
The epoch is January 1, 1997, at 00:00:00. A value of
0 refers to this date and time.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapEpochTime

description: A unique index that identifies the occurence of this
event. This ID can be correlated between traps, logs
and the like.
variables.name: MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapID

description: A esrConfigurationTrap is sent by the agent when the
configuration event is triggered. These events are
triggered when a configuration change is made.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrConfigurationTrap MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapEventIndex i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapTime t 31536000 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapDescr s EXAMPLE MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapType i 9 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapSeverity i 20 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapDTM s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAM MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResType i 1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapResLeaf i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapValueType i 1 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapValue s EXAMPLE MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapEpochTime i 9999 MARCONI-ESR-MIB::esrEventTrapID i 9999

event. This ID can be correlated between traps, logs

description: A esrTemperatureTrap is sent by the agent when the
temperature event is triggered. This event is
triggered when a temperature probe detects the
temperature crossing a threshold.

description: A esrResourceTrap is sent by the agent when the
resource event is triggered. The resource event is
triggered when a resource is added or removed from the
system.
